instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Battery Charge Icon
threads.message: Hi all, I have a 00928 board on my bench. It came in with 5v 0.21a, PPBUS was 0.5v. Found that <CAPACITOR>C6913</CAPACITOR> was getting molten hot so replaced it and now the machine gets to 20v and comes on, but it only gets to a "charge battery" screen for a few seconds and then shuts off. This happens with both battery + charger as well as charger alone. What should I be checking next in this case? Replaced <DIODE>D6902</DIODE> on a whim as well.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Battery Charge Icon
threads.message:
Did you test with original 87W charger?
Also try with knwon good battery.
